conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D isometric view with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volumes exposed via roof/ceiling removal.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners, clear floor/wall separation, correct angled projection, and a consistent cutaway; only minor simplification in some wall-top/trim detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (2 beds, living/dining center, kitchen near entry, two toilets, balconies/decks). Some proportional/layout simplifications and a few openings/partition positions appear slightly shifted versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present: beds in both bedrooms, living seating + table, kitchen cabinetry/appliances, bathroom fixtures. Furniture generally placed in correct rooms with reasonable scale.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good lighting and materials; walls/openings are distinguishable. Minor occlusions from camera angle and uniform wall color reduce some opening/door readability.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: some room dimensions/partition alignments (notably around toilet/foyer/transition areas) appear simplified compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/window/opening placements and sizes are not perfectly verifiable/matched due to viewpoint and simplification; a few openings seem slightly shifted from the 2D plan.
Uniform wall materials and camera occlusion make certain door swings/opening details less clear than in the 2D plan.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric fidelity and largely correct room layout, with only minor proportional and opening-placement deviations from the 2D plan.
